Submodules¶

libs.simulation.ngsolve.CSGeometry module¶

class libs.simulation.ngsolve.CSGeometry.CSGeometry(data_handler: DataHandler)¶

Bases: object

Generates the CSGeometries for the objects in the scenery and composes them to the overall geometry including all

elements of the simulation.

Parameters:

data_handler (DataHandler) – Object of the Data class containing all simulation relevant data.

data_handler: DataHandler¶
init_geometry(data_handler: DataHandler) → CSGeometry¶

Creates the overall geometry of all elements of the simulation. Result can be displayed in the netgen gui.

Parameters:

data_handler (DataHandler) – Object of the Data class containing all simulation relevant data.

Returns:

Geometry of the whole scenery.

Return type:

netgen.csg.CSGeometry

materials: Dict[str, str]¶

libs.simulation.ngsolve.NGField module¶

class libs.simulation.ngsolve.NGField.NGField(data_handler: DataHandler)¶

Bases: MagneticField, ABC

Implementation of MagneticField based on features provided by the ngsolve package.

Parameters:

  • data_handler (DataHandler) – Object of the Data class containing all simulation relevant data.

  • mu0 (float) – Magnetic field constant.

  • mur (ngsolve.CoefficientFunction) – Magnetic permeability for the materials in the scenery.

  • b_field (ngsolve.CoefficientFunction) – Magnetic flux density field defined on the created mesh.

  • h_field (ngsolve.CoefficientFunction) – Magnetic field strength field defined on the created mesh.

  • gfu (ngsolve.GridFunction) – Vector potential.

  • mag (ngsolve.CoefficientFunction) – Magnetisation of the objects in the scenery.

  • ng_mesh (NGMesh) – Object of the mesh class handling the CSGeometries.

b_field: CoefficientFunction¶
create_field(data_handler: DataHandler, t: float) → None¶

Method to initialize and calculate the magnetic field based on the given parameters.

Parameters:

  • data_handler (DataHandler) – Object of the Data class containing all simulation relevant data.

  • t (float) – Current time stamp:

data_handler: DataHandler¶
draw() → None¶

Method to draw the magnetic field strength and the magnetic flux density in the Netgen gui.

get_b_field(x: ndarray, y: ndarray, z: ndarray) → ndarray | None¶

Method to extract the magnetic flux density on positions defined by a grid on x, y and z.

Parameters:

  • x (numpy.ndarray) – x grid.

  • y (numpy.ndarray) – y grid.

  • z (numpy.ndarray) – z grid.

Returns:

Magnetic flux density on the grid passed.

Return type:

Union[np.ndarray, None]

get_h_field(x: ndarray, y: ndarray, z: ndarray) → ndarray | None¶

Method to extract the magnetic field strength on positions defined by a grid on x, y and z.

Parameters:

  • x (numpy.ndarray) – x grid.

  • y (numpy.ndarray) – y grid.

  • z (numpy.ndarray) – z grid.

Returns:

Magnetic field strength on the grid passed.

Return type:

Union[np.ndarray, None]

ng_mesh: NGMesh¶

libs.simulation.ngsolve.NGMesh module¶

class libs.simulation.ngsolve.NGMesh.NGMesh(data_handler: DataHandler)¶

Bases: object

Generates the CSGeometries for the objects in the scenery and generates the mesh on which the finite element

simulation is calculated. Includes the necessary mesh operations to fulfill the manual mesh approach.

Parameters:

  • data_handler (DataHandler) – Object of the Data class containing all simulation relevant data.

  • mp (netgen.meshing.MeshingParameters) – Meshing parameters.

  • netgen_mesh (netgen.meshing.Mesh) – Full mesh in Netgen.

  • mesh_badness (float) – Initial badness of unrotated automatically generated netgen mesh.

  • mesh (ngsolve.Mesh) – Full mesh converted to Ngsolve.

  • init_mesh_t (float) – Time stamp of the frame the mesh got rebuilt.

add_fd(mesh_to: Mesh, domin: int, domout: int, bcname: str)¶

Add the face descriptors related to bcname from mesh_from to mesh_to. Returns a map of the transferred surface numbers.

static aspect_ratio(mesh: Mesh)¶

Calculates the maximum aspect ratio of the edges in the cells of the mesh.

Parameters:

mesh (netgen.meshing.Mesh) – Netgen Mesh

Returns:

The maximum ratio of all cell edge length ratios in the mesh.

Return type:

float

copy_2d(mesh_to: Mesh, mesh_from: Mesh, pmap: Dict[int, int], domin: int, domout: int, bcname: str) → None¶

Method to copy 2D elements from one mesh to another.

Parameters:

  • mesh_to (msh.Mesh) – Output mesh.

  • mesh_from (Output mesh.) – Input mesh.

  • pmap (Dict[int, int]) – Dictionary of the mapped indexes.

  • domin (int) – Domain of the 3D elements enclosed by the copied 2D elements.

  • domout (int) – Domain of the 3D elements enclosing the copied 2D elements.

  • bcname (str) – Name of the boundary which is built by the copied 2D elements.

copy_3d(mesh_to: Mesh, mesh_from: Mesh, pmap: Dict[int, int])¶

Method to copy 3D elements from one mesh to another.

Parameters:

  • mesh_to (msh.Mesh) – Output mesh.

  • mesh_from (Output mesh.) – Input mesh.

  • pmap (Dict[int, int]) – Dictionary of the mapped indexes.

copy_mesh(mesh_to: Mesh, mesh_from: Mesh, domin: int, domout: int, bcname: str) → None¶

Method to copy an entire mesh including 2D and 3D elements.

Parameters:

  • mesh_to (msh.Mesh) – Output mesh.

  • mesh_from (Output mesh.) – Input mesh.

  • domin (int) – Domain of the 3D elements enclosed by the copied 2D elements.

  • domout (int) – Domain of the 3D elements enclosing the copied 2D elements.

  • bcname (str) – Name of the boundary which is built by the copied 2D elements.

copy_surface(mesh_to: Mesh, mesh_from: Mesh, domin: int, domout: int, bcname: str) → None¶

Method to copy an entire surface of a solid body.

Parameters:

  • mesh_to (msh.Mesh) – Output mesh.

  • mesh_from (Output mesh.) – Input mesh.

  • domin (int) – Domain of the 3D elements enclosed by the copied 2D elements.

  • domout (int) – Domain of the 3D elements enclosing the copied 2D elements.

  • bcname (str) – Name of the boundary which is built by the copied 2D elements.

data_handler: DataHandler¶
static facedescriptor_list(mesh: Mesh) → list¶

Return list of face descriptors of the mesh.

Method to initialize the full mesh and geometry.

Parameters:

  • mp (netgen.mesh.MeshingParameters) – Meshing parameters.

Returns:

Full mesh and its badness.

List[Union[netgen.meshing.Mesh, float]]

max_surfnr(mesh: Mesh) → int¶

Return biggest surface number of occurring in mesh.

mesh: Mesh¶
mesh_badness: float¶
static mesh_diagnose(mesh: Mesh, description: str = '')¶

Print several mesh parameters mainly for the purpose of debugging.

Parameters:

  • mesh (msh.Mesh) – Mesh investigated.

  • description (str) – Name to identify the printed mesh parameters in case of multiple method calls.

mp: MeshingParameters¶
netgen_mesh: Mesh¶
nr_bcs(mesh: Mesh) → int¶

Return number of boundary conditions of the mesh.

static pmap2d(mesh_to: Mesh, mesh_from: Mesh) → Dict[int, int]¶
Creates a dictionary mapping the indexes of points building elements of the input mesh to the output mesh.

Only 2D elements are considered.

Parameters:

  • mesh_to (msh.Mesh) – Output mesh.

  • mesh_from (Output mesh.) – Input mesh.

Returns:

Dictionary of the mapped indexes.

Return type:

Dict[int, int]

static pmap3d(mesh_to: Mesh, mesh_from: Mesh) → Dict[int, int]¶
Creates a dictionary mapping the indexes of points building elements of the input mesh to the output mesh.

Considers 2D and 3D elements.

Parameters:

  • mesh_to (msh.Mesh) – Output mesh.

  • mesh_from (Output mesh.) – Input mesh.

Returns:

Dictionary of the mapped indexes.

Return type:

Dict[int, int]

static restrict_mesh(data_handler: DataHandler, mp: MeshingParameters) → None¶

Restrict the maximum mesh size on chosen points of the grid.

Parameters:

  • data_handler (DataHandler) – Object of the Data class containing all simulation relevant data.

  • mp (msh.MeshingParameters) – Meshing parameters.

static rotate_gear_mesh(mesh: Mesh, mp: MeshingParameters, data_handler: DataHandler, idx: int) → List[Mesh | float]¶

Method to rotate the gear in the mesh by one time step and optimize it.

Parameters:

  • mesh (netgen.meshing.Mesh) – Netgen mesh.

  • mp (netgen.meshing.MeshingParameters) – Meshing parameters.

  • data_handler (DataHandler) – Object of the Data class containing all simulation relevant data.

  • idx (int) – Index of the gear object in data_handler

Returns:

The rotated and optimized mesh and its badness.

Return type:

List[union[netgen.meshing.Mesh, float]]

static skewness(mesh: Mesh)¶

Calculates the maximum skewness of the edges in the cells of the mesh.

Parameters:

mesh (netgen.meshing.Mesh) – Netgen Mesh

Returns:

The maximum skewness of all cells in the mesh.

Return type:

float

static smoothness(mesh: Mesh)¶

To be implemented.

static transfer_materials(mesh_to: Mesh, mesh_from: Mesh) → None¶

Transfers the materials from mesh_from to mesh_to.

update(data_handler: DataHandler, t: float) → None¶

The method updates the mesh based on the current rotation angle of the gear theta. When possible, the gears mesh gets rotated and optimized. If the badness of the rotated mesh exceeds a certain badness, the full mesh gets rebuild.

Module contents¶

Virtual Magnetic Sensor
